question: 1 (b) ii
sols_html:
The tangent line must have the same slope as the function \(f(x)\) at \(x = 1/2\). Solving for the slope \(m\), we get

\[\begin{aligned} m = f'(1/2) = -\pi\sin\left(\frac{\pi}{2}\right) = -\pi.\end{aligned}\]

The tangent line must also touch the function at \(x = 1/2\). We use this to solve for the y-intercept:

\[\begin{aligned} y &= mx + b \\ \cos\left(\frac{\pi}{2}\right) &= -\pi\left(\frac{1}{2}\right) + b \\ 0 &= -\frac{\pi}{2} + b \\ b &= \frac{\pi}{2}\end{aligned}\]

Therefore, the tangent line to \(f(x) = \cos(\pi x)\) at \(x = 1/2\) is:

\[\begin{aligned} {\color{blue}y = -\pi x + \frac{\pi}{2}}\end{aligned}\]
